text:
- I'm Malik and I'm a software
engineer on Amazon S3.
I've been with AWS for almost 10 years.
(upbeat music)
Before coming to AWS, I was in college

and studying in college,
I knew I wanted to learn
about distributed systems,
how to build them, how to operate them,
and I knew that AWS was the place to come
to learn how to do that.

Coming in, I didn't know I
was gonna stay here 10 years.
I had no plan, I just wanted to learn

and I'm still learning
now so I'm still here.
My role at AWS is to help build
and maintain our systems.

I work on Amazon S3,
which is a storage system
which is responsible
for storing and retrieving customer data

so our job is to make
sure that we can do that

in the safest, most reliable,
most optimal way possible.
Looking back over the last 10 years,

the times I'm the most proud
is when the team that I'm on

has come together to
really build something
for our customers.
And then to look back and to see
that it went from an inception,

at some point it was an
idea on a dry-erase board,

and now it's in customer's
hands, actively being used,

making their workloads easier,
helping their applications.
Like, that's very rewarding.
And to keep being able to to do that
in different spaces is awesome.
(upbeat music)

AWS has allowed me to maintain
great work-life balance.

I have six children at home,
my wife also works at AWS

in an Engineering position,
we both have the same job
and we're both able to grow professionally
and take care of our family.
(upbeat music)
